comments.species: Stereotaxic injections of lentiviruses were made into the CA1 region of P18-22 C57BL/6 mice ...
comments.rationale:
Postsynaptic knock-down (KD) of Complexin-1 and -2 (shRNA stereotactic in vivo injection into CA1 region of the hippocampus) blocks LTP (Fig. 1 F), indicating that Complexin plays a role in postsynaptic membrane fusion events underlying the exocytosis of AMPA receptors during LTP. 

NMDA-Receptor mediated LTD is unaffected by postsynaptic Complexin KD (Fig. 1 H). 

Block of LTP can be rescued by expression of a shRNA-resitant full-length Complexin-1 variant (Fig. 1 G).  

Basal synaptic transmission is not affected by postsynaptic Complexin KD in slices (Fig.2) and cultures (Fig 4B), indicating that Complexin only regulates AMPA-Receptor exocytosis.

comments.species: Cplx1+/+ and Cplx1−/− littermates of either sex were used for most of the experiments...
comments.rationale:
Complexin-1 immunreactivity is present in the somata of the MNTB principal neurons indicating postsynaptic localization (Fig. 1C). Complexin-1 is present in the presynapse (co-localizing with the synaptic vesicle marker Vglut1) in the Calyx of Held terminal of the MNTB in the brainstem.

IHC was performed using an antibody (SySy, rabbit anti-Cplx-1/2) that detects Complexin-1 and -2. Complexin-1 KO mice exhibit a loss of immunoreactivity in the somata of the MNTB principal neurons (Fig 11C) indicating the specificity of the antibody.

comments.species: Cplx1+/+ and Cplx1−/− littermates of either sex were used for most of the experiments...
comments.rationale:
Complexin-2 presynaptic immunoreactivity is observed in the Calyx of Held synapse in the brainstem (Fig 11C).

IHC was performed using an antibody (SySy, rabbit anti-Cplx-1/2) that detects Complexin-1 and -2. Complexin-1 KO mice exhibit a loss of immunoreactivity in the somata of the MNTB principal neurons (Fig 11C) indicating the specificity of the antibody for Complexin-1, however immunoreactivity in the presynaptic terminal persist at P7 indicating the presence of Complexin-2.

comments.species: Cplx1+/+ and Cplx1−/− littermates of either sex were used for most of the experiments...
comments.rationale:
Complexin-1 is present in the presynapse (co-localizing with the synaptic vesicle marker Vglut1) in the Calyx of Held terminal of the MNTB in the brainstem (Fig.1C). Complexin-2 expression is downregulated in Calyx of Held terminals during development (Fig.11). At P21, Vglut-1 immunoreactivity does not colocalize with with Complexin-immunoreactivity in Complexin-1 KO mice (Fig.11C). Therefore, the immunoreactivity in wild-type Calyx of Held terminals at P21 must originate from the presence of Complexin-1 in the presynapse (Fig.1C).
Complexin-1 immunreactivity is present in the somata of the MNTB principal neurons indicating also a postsynaptic localization. 

IHC was performed using an antibody (SySy, rabbit anti-Cplx-1/2) that detects Complexin-1 and -2. Complexin-1 KO mice exhibit a loss of immunoreactivity in the somata of the MNTB principal neurons (Fig 11C) indicating the specificity of the antibody.

comments.rationale:
Pre-embedding immuno-EM indicates immunoreactivity for Complexin-2 in axon terminals (vesicles, plasma membrane) and it filled the axoplasm in a varying degree in different synapse types and brain regions. EM localization indicates that a larger proportion of the protein may be associated to membranes (in comparison to the subcellular fractionation, where most of the synaphins are in the soluble, cytosolic fraction - Referenced to SynGO annotation #577 ).

monoclonal antibodies (mAbs) specific to synaphin 1 (12C5) were generated in the study. No KO control.

comments.species:
Neuron culture and transfection. Hippocampal neurons derived from
embryonic day 18 Sprague Dawley fetal rats of either sex were prepared as
described previously
comments.rationale:
The paper tests the effect of SCAMP5 knock-down on SV recycling and endocytosis. Rat hippocampal neurons were cotransfected with vGpH (a vesicular glutamate transporter-1 fused with pHluorin), and shRNA against SCAMP5. 
Figure 3 describes the endocytosis of SVs following 300 APs at 10 Hz, as monitored by following the vGpH signal, and demonstrates that endocytosis is slowed in the knock-down neurons. The effect can be rescued by the re-expression of SCAMP5.
Figure 4 shows that the knock-down of SCAMP5 impairs endocytosis during stimulation. The neurons are stimulated by an AP train (300 APs at 10 Hz) to evaluate exocytosis, and, following recovery, by a train of 1200 APs at 10 Hz in the presence of Bafilomycin A1 (blocking SV reacidification following exocytosis), to evaluate the size of the recycling SV pool. This experiment demonstrates that the ratio of Endocytosis to exocytosis is lower in SCAMP5 KD neurons, suggesting that the fraction of the released SVs that undergoes endocytosis during the stimulation is lower than in the WT controls. The effect was fully rescued by the re-expression of SCAMP5.

comments.rationale:
SV31 (TMEM163) is a SV membrane protein with 6 predicted transmembrane helices (Fig.1).

Fig.4: Immunoblotting after subcellular fractionation of synaptosomes: Rat and mouse crude synaptic fractions exhibited a band at 31kDa using a polyclonal peptide antibody to the N-terminal aa48-63 (Fig. 4a). Fractions obtained from a sucrose density gradient revealed a bimodal distribution of SV31 similarly to Synaptotagmin-1 with an enrichment in the low density SV fraction and the denser membrane fractions (which contain both plasma membrane and SVs that attach to the plasma membrane) (Fig.4b). 

Antibody: No KO-control, but no signals were obtained from Western Blots of total brain homogenates when the pre-immune serum was applied.

Of note: Only a very small proportion of synaptosomes were labelled. Gold particles were bound only to SVs, whereas other membranes were unlabelled.

Antibody: polyclonal peptide antibody to the N-terminal aa48-63 generated in the study. No KO-control, but no signals were obtained from Western Blots of total brain homogenates when the pre-immune serum was applied. No immunostaining was obtained with preimmune serum or when only the secondary antibody was applied for IHC.

comments.species: "Generation of  βT-Eif4e transgenic mice (eIF-4E transgenic mice) has been described previously ..."
comments.rationale:
eIF-4E is involved in cap-dependent initation of translation (Fig. 1). Exaggerated expression of eIF-4E causes alterations in synaptic function, dendritic spine density and synaptic plasticity (Fig. 3).

8/8/2017 Pim
- eIF-4E KO shown to enhance translation and shown to have enhaced mPFC, striatal and hippocampal LTD. The LTD defects are rescued by application of a translation blocker (4EGI-1). These observations together fully support the selected term.

The supplemental table S1 contains proteins identified in the PSD preparation (Synaptic junctional protein preparation).
For proteins coming from datasets derived from PSD (detergent-resistant synaptic junctions) preparations without defined selection / enrichment of the pre- or postsynaptic compartment we cannot assign these proteins to excitatory and/or inhibitory nor to the presynapse or / and postsynapse without further information.

comments.species: Wistar rats, kept at the animal facilities at the Institute of Basic Medical Sciences, University of Oslo (Norway) or at VU University Medical Center (Amsterdam, The Netherlands), were handled according to the European regulations and under veterinary agreement and supervision.
comments.rationale:
Purified synaptic vesicles from a crude hippocampal LS1 fraction were analyzed using immunogold electron microscopy and western blotting to identify the localization of VGLUT2. 
For figure 4a, synaptic vesicles were double stained for VGLUT2 and VGAT (arrow heads; large gold particles). The image clearly shows VGLUT2-labelled SVs. No KO control, secondary antibody alone did not produce a signal.
in Figure 4b the LS1 fraction was analyzed using western blotting. A clear signal for VGLUT2 was observed in the total crude vesicular fraction, indicating that a subset of SVs in the fraction is expressing VGLUT2. In a sub-fraction of these SVs that was enriched for VGAT expression using immunoisolation, no signal for VGLUT2 was seen, which could be used as an indication for the specificity of the anti-VGLUT2 antibody.

comments.species: Wistar rats (6-week-old males) were killed by decapitation and forebrains were dissected and stored at )80C until use (p. 65)
comments.rationale: LC3a is found in synaptic proteomes. Table S2 contains proteins identified in PSD-associated lipid rafts.

comments.species:
Here we present a large-scale proteomic analysis of the
postsynaptic proteome (PSP) of mouse brain. p.17
comments.rationale:
Supplemental table S1 contains 698 synaptic proteins identified in three different experimental approaches: isolated PSD preparation, MAGUK-associated signalling complexes (MASC) and AMPA receptor complexes (ARCs).
TTYH1_MOUSE was found in the isolated PSD fraction.
For proteins coming from datasets derived from PSD (detergent-resistant synaptic junctions) preparations without defined selection / enrichment of the pre- or postsynaptic compartment we cannot assign these proteins to excitatory and/or inhibitory nor to the presynapse or / and postsynapse without further information.

comments.species:
Fig. 3A/B: immunoblot analysis of Fbxo45 in adult **mice** is shown.
Fig. 3C: "immunocytochemistry of primary cultured **rat** hippocampal neurons expressing Fbxo45 is shown."
Fig. 3D: Immuno-EM on froze brain sections, **mouse** (see below)

25/4/2017 Pim
- Contacted the authors asking for species of tissue used in Fig 3D. The authors answered:
"Dear Dr. Pim van Nierop,

Thank you for asking.
I'm Hirobumi Tada, first author in JBC paper.
We used mouse in the EM study.

Sincerely yours,
Hirobumi Tada
"

Since the highest resolution data is obtianed with *mouse* species. I propose to annotate the mouse protein.
comments.rationale:
Fbxo45 is enriched in synaptic fractions. Fbxo45 immunoreactivity colocalizes with a presynaptic marker, VGlut1, and a postsynaptic marker, PSD-95  in both pre- and postsynaptic structures of excitatory hippocampal neurons in culture. Analyses using immunoelectron microscopy revealed expression of Fbxo45 (brain region not specified).

25/4/2017 Pim
- "Cytosol" was infered from the observation that Fbxo45 does not associate with recognizable intracellular structures and the absence of membrane-targeting domains in the Fbxo45 protein.

comments.species: "Dorfin−/− mice were generated from mouse sperm with the gene trap cassette inserted into the intron between exon 2 and exon 3 of the Dorfin gene, obtained from TIGM (OST244733). Mice in the genetic background of 129/SvEv were backcrossed with C57BL6 mice for more than five generations."
comments.rationale:
Dorfin binds to PSD-95 (Figure 1)
Dorfin null mutant mice show normal brain and dendrite morphology (Figure 2)
Dorfin null mutant mice show increased mEPSC amplitude and enhanced LTP in the hippocampal DG region. mEPSC frequency and paired-pulse ratio is not affected. Neither is mIPSC amplitude/frequency (Figure 4).

23/5/2017 Pim
- Dorfin is a known E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase
- Fig.7 25 proteins were shown to be under-phosphorylated in hippcampal lysates.
- So, dorfin is a known E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase that is active in hippocampus, interacts with PSD-95, and affects postsynaptic, but not presynaptic function of Glutamatergic synapses.

Purified synaptic vesicles from a crude hippocampal LS1 fraction were analyzed using immunogold electron microscopy and western blotting to identify the localization of VGAT.

in Figure 4b the LS1 fraction was analyzed using western blotting. A clear signal for VGAT was observed in the total crude vesicular fraction, indicating that a subset of SVs in the fraction is expressing VGAT. VGAT has TM domains --> integral component of....

comments.species: Adult flies; Canton S background.
comments.rationale:
orb2-GFP is detected both pre- and post-synaptically in the mushroom body calyx by immuno-EM using anti-GFP antibodies.

In addition, the paper provides evidence of impaired long-term memory in Orb2 mutants, suggesting a role in synaptic plasticity (Fig. 3-4). 

Both conclusions are supported by Majumdar et al., Cell 2012, and the loss of long.term memory also in Keleman et al., Nat. Neurosci 2007.

Note that the fruit fly has only two CPEB isoforms agains four in mammals. Orb2 could equally be the functional ortholog of CPEB2, CPEB3, or CPEB4 (or all three at the same time).

comments.species: "Starting from a preparation of purified nerve terminals obtained from rat brain.." from abstract
comments.rationale:
Clathrin-coated vesicles (CCVs), which by nature are coated with the annotated protein, clathrin heavy chain (CHC), are purified from pre-synaptic nerve terminals. The authors demonstrate in figure 2 that the CCVs are from the pre-synaptic compartment because they require osmotic shock to be released (because they are trapped in intact synaptosomes) whereas CCVs from other parts of the cell, including the post-synapse, would not require this treatment. In figure 4 the authors demonstrate by coomassie staining and western blot that the CCVs are highly enriched in CHC and multiple synaptic vesicle (SV) proteins, clearly indicating that CCVs are involved in SV recycling. Figure 7 uses immuno-electron microscopy to demonstrate that CCVs isolated from the pre-synaptic compartment and whole brain show very similar levels of staining for the SV protein synaptophysin, indicating that the major localization of CHC in brain is on CCVs that recycle SVs.

22/5/2017 Pim
- I agree with the expert. The vesicles  isolated from synaptosomes are (i) shown to contain CHC and (ii) show to be SV's because containing typical SV proteins.

comments.species: From materials and methods, "Primary cultures of rat hippocampal neurons were prepared from E18 rats and cocultured with glia".
comments.rationale:
The authors use synaptopHlourin (synaptophysin tagged to a pH sensitive GFP) to measure the endocytosis of synaptic vesicles (SVs) into presynaptic nerve terminals in rat hippocampal cultures. Using siRNA to knockdown the annotated protein, clathrin heavy chain (CHC), the authors see reduced SV endocytosis in response to low frequency stimulation.

22/5/2017 Pim
- Clathrin is a protein that performs the endocytosis itself. The "regulates ..." box should not be checked

Fig.3

- Protein has TM domains (Uniprot) justifying an "integral component... " extension.

comments.species:
To analyze whether P45 represents a novel glutamate transporter, its cDNA was stably expressed in the serotoninergic endocrine cell line BON (Evers et al., 1991).
*BON cell line is derived from a metastatic human carcinoid tumor of the pancreas.
comments.rationale:
The paper is the first characterization of VGLUT3.

Figure 2 shows [3H]L- glutamate uptake in intracellular membrane vesicles obtained from BON cell lysates stably expressing VGLUT3, VGLUT2 or mock vesicles.
Figure 2a and 2b demonstrate the fraction of [3H]L- glutamate uptake that is sensitive to the H+ ionophore CCCP. CCCP-sensitive uptake is seen in VGLUT3 and VGLUT2-expressing membranes, but not in the mock membranes.
Figure 2c demonstrates the glutamate specificity of VGLUT3.

Figure 3 presents the kinetics of VGLUT2 and VGLUT3-dependent glutamate transport.

comments.species:
From legend to fig 10, "The 0.5 μm thin sections of the mouse retina..."

From legend to fig 11, "The 0.5 μm thin sections from mouse retina..."

From legend to fig 12, "Ultrathin sections of the mouse retina..."
comments.rationale:
The authors use super resolution structured illumination microscopy (fig 10 and 11) to localize clathrin-hevay chain (CHC) to the area surrounding both the bassoon-labeled active zone and the RIBEYE-immunolabeled synaptic ribbon in mouse photoreceptor synapses. The authors use multiple well-characterized antibodies against CHC for these localization studies. In fig 12 they use immunogold labelling to reveal CHC localization to the plasma membrane in close proximity to the synaptic ribbon). The immunogold labeling experiments confirm the previously shown immunofluorescence labeling data and demonstrate the enrichment of CHC-V1 in the periactive zone of the photoreceptor ribbon synapse.

22/5/2017 Pim
The "extrinsic" membrane association is derived from the absense of TM or lipid anchors and the known interaction of clathrin to transmembrane cargo adapter molecules (not shown in this paper).

comments.species:
From the abstract, "We show that although synaptojanin is recruited by endophilin at bud necks before fission, the knockout of all three mouse endophilins results in the accumulation of clathrin-coated vesicles, but not of clathrin-coated pits, at synapses".

19/6/2017 Pim
The overexpressed endophilin 1 was of rat species. Literal: "A rat endophilin 1 FL-mRFP under control of the CAG promote"
comments.rationale:
The authors generate triple knockout (KO) mice for mouse endophilin 1, 2 and 3. One problem with this paper is that while it CLEARLY demonstrates a vital role for endophilins in synaptic vesicle (SV) recycling, it remains somewhat unclear as to which endophilin isoform is required. 

In fig 4, the authors generate cortical neuron cultures from endophilin 1/2/3 triple KO mice. They use synaptopHlourin (both the synaptophysin or vGLUT forms) to monitor SV endocytosis. Following a 10Hz for 30 sec stimulus (300 action potentials) the rate of SV recovery by endocytosis is measured. The triple KO mice show a significant decrease in endocytosis. Importantly, fig 4B/D/E show that this phenotype can be rescues by full-length endophilin 1. 

In fig 5 the authors use EM in mouse cortical cultures to demonstrate that the endophilin triple KO mice have a massive accumulation of clathrin-coated vesicles (CCVs). This demonstrates that endophilins are required for uncoating CCVs but not for their formation or fission, but does not distinguish between endophilin isoforms.

19/6/2017 Pim
- The role of endophilin 1 is shown by the rescue of the tripple KO phenotype by over-expression of rat endophilin 1.

comments.species:
M&M: 
"Subcellularly, SCRAPPER was enriched in synaptic membrane fractions from the **mouse** brain (Figure 1D)."
"Primary cultured neurons from SCR-KO **mice** were prepared with P1– P3 mice".
comments.rationale: Fbxl20/SCRAPPER is enriched in synaptic membrane fractions from mouse brain (Figure 1D). Immunofluorescence analysis revealed a punctate distribution of SCRAPPER (Figure 1F) that predominantly colocalized with synaptophysin, a known synaptic vesicle protein and presynapse marker.

comments.species: M&M: "Primary cultured neurons from SCR-KO **mice** were prepared with P1– P3 mice".
comments.rationale:
Fbxl20 ubiquitinates and degrades the active zone protein Rim-1 (Fig.2-4). Fbxl20 null mutant hippocampal neurons show increased spontaneous (mEPSC) frequency but not amplitude. The increased mEPSC frequency can be rescued to wild type levels by shRNA-mediated depletion of RIM-1. In hippocampal slices from Fbxl20 null mutant mice increased mini frequency can be rescued by blocking proteasome activity. Hence Fbxl20 modulates synaptic transmission by ubiquitination and degradation of Rim-1.

23/5/20176 Pim
- Experiments:
Fig.2 Fbxl20 binds SCF complex proteins involved in ubiquitination (co-IP, mouse brain), binds ubiquitinated proteins (co-IP overexpressed Fbxl20, heterologous cells), binds RIM1 (co-IP, mouse brain), colocalizes with RIM1 in neurons (conf.IF, cultured neurons), directly interacts with RIM1 (co-IP, cell free system), and mediates ubiquitination of RIM1 protein (co-IP, western blot, cell free system).
Fig.3 Levels of RIM1 protein are increased and levels of RIM1 ubiquitination are decreased in Fbxl20 KO mice (IP + western blot, genetic transformation).
Fig.4-7 Fbxl20 KO changes synaptic ultrastructure and SV release (Ephys, genetic transformation)

comments.species: From the abstract, "Unexpectedly, mice lacking dynamin 1 were able to form functional synapses, even though their postnatal viability was limited. However, during spontaneous network activity, branched, tubular plasma membrane invaginations accumulated, capped by clathrin-coated pits, in synapses of dynamin 1-knockout mice. Synaptic vesicle endocytosis was severely impaired during strong exogenous stimulation but resumed efficiently when the stimulus was terminated".
comments.rationale: The authors generate dynamin 1 knockout (KO) mice. In fig 3 they demonstrate by electron microscopy that in cortical cultures from these mice, there is an accumulation of clathrin-coated profiles that remain attached to the plasma membrane, clearly indicating  a deficiency in the fission of clathrin-coated pits. In fig 5 they use synaptopHlourin (both synaptobrevin and synaptotagmin versions) to measure synaptic vesicle (SV) endocytosis. If one compares fig 5A (no baflomycin) to fig 5B (with baflomycin) one sees that during an intense stimulation (30 secs of 10 Hz stimulus) there is a big difference between wt and KO in terms of the amount of SV recycling. However, at the end of the stimulus (30 sec) the rates of recovery and thus the rates of endocytosis are exactly the same (compare the slopes of the black lines in A versus B). Thus, dynamin 1 is required for SV endocytosis only during active stimulation and not during recovery.

comments.species: Littermate offspring obtained from matings of the CSP-α-KO-spHtg line was used for experiments.
comments.rationale:
The SV protein CSPalpha is not essential for synaptic transmission, but acts as a chaperone for SNAP-25 to regulate the synaptic vesicle cycle (i.e. SV recycling and SV priming).

CSPalpha KO NMJ nerve terminals were analyzed by electrophysiology (Fig. 1) and they exhibit a reduction in the RRP due to a defect in vesicle priming (Fig. 1H) - probably due to a loss of SNAP-25 (Fig. 2). Measurements of Synapto-pHluorin (SpH) fluorescence in response to high-frequency trains of action potentials reveals an impairment of vesicle recycling/endocytosis in CSPalpha KO terminals (Fig.4-6).

comments.species: Equal amounts of subcellular fractions from rat brain (20 μg/lane) were analyzed with specific antibodies...
comments.rationale:
Subcellular fractionation: CSP was mainly found in the synaptic vesicle fraction (LP2). It was not detectable in cytosolic fractions (S3, LS2), implying that the entire pool of CSP is subject to palmitoylation and membrane bound. 

Polyclonal rabbit antibody directed against rat CSP was generated with GST fusion proteins containing full-length CSPa construct. Specificity of the antibody was demonstrated comparing control and CSPa KO mouse brains by Western Blot (Fig.4D).

23/5/2017 Pim
Uniprot states that CSpa is palmitoylated. This and the experimental evidence support the "anchored component... " term

comments.species:
From M&M section:
- The original human yotiao cDNA fragment, clone A1.7, was used as a hybridization probe to obtain from a 5 -Stretch Plus human brain cDNA phage library (Clontech) further clones (3-1, 9-1, 21-1, 25-1, and 25-2) that encompassed residues 138–1642 of the putative yotiao protein.
-Brain immunohistochemistry was performed on Vibratome-cut 50  m floating brain sections from Sprague Dawley rats ( 6 weeks of age).
-Subcellular fractions of whole rat brain were prepared as described (Huttner et al., 1983).

10/8/2017 Pim
- PPI is shown with human Yotiao and **unknown species** NR1 proteins.
comments.rationale:
Yotiao is a protein that interacts with the NMDA receptor subunit NR1 (Fig.3). The protein is membrane associated and enriched in postsynaptic densities obtained after biochemical fractionation of the rat brain (Fig.5). Immunolabeling of Yotiao and NR1 show colocalizing immunoreactivity in somatodendritic puncta in pyramidal neurons of the rat cerebral cortex (Fig.7).

13/6/2017 Pim
- The yotiao protein comes from the Akap9 gene. There is no reviewed rat sequence in Uniprot. There is a fragment (~350 aa) in Uniprot that bears the name Yotiao, but this seems to be a partial fragment. I selected full length Akap9 for annotation.
- Paper shows (1) localization to PSD and (2) interaction with NR1 but does not show direct interaction with NR1 at the PSD. Therefore the evidenced term is PSD, and later a inferred annotation to 'extrinsic component of postsynaptic density membrane (GO:0099147)' will be added.

comments.species: From the abstract, "Although lack of dynamin 3 does not produce an overt phenotype in mice, it worsens the dynamin 1 KO phenotype, leading to perinatal lethality and a more severe defect in activity-dependent synaptic vesicle endocytosis".
comments.rationale: The authors use dynamin 1 knock out (KO) mice, dynamin 3 KO mice and dynamin 1/3 double KO mice. Using cultured cortical neurons with vGlut1-pHlourin, they demonstrate in fig 4B that fluorescence recovery after stimulation, which is indicative of synaptic vesicle (SV) endocytosis is decreased in dynamin 1 KO mice, is not effected in dynamin 3 KO mice, but is dramatically reduced in dynamin 1/3 double KO mice. Thus, dynamin 1 and 3, which together account for the overwhelming majority of brain dynamin, cooperate in supporting optimal rates of synaptic vesicle endocytosis

comments.species: To determine whether DNPI transports glutamate into secretory vesicles, we used heterologous expression in rat pheochromocytoma PC12 cells.
comments.rationale:
The paper is the first description of VGLUT2 (formally called DNPI) as a glutamate transporter. 

Figure 7c-e shows the stable expression of VGLUT2 in PC12 cells.

Figure 8a presents the [3H]L-glutamate uptake in a fraction of light membranes that include synaptic-like microvesicles prepared by lysing PC12 cells that stably express VGLUT2. The figure shows that these membranes take up more glutamate then the WT control (where no expression of VGLUT2 can be detected). Figure 8c shows specificity of the transporter to glutamate, since the inclusion of non-lablelled glutamate is blocked [3H]L-glutamate uptake. Non-labelled L-aspartate, D-aspartate, glycine, or γ-aminobutyric acid had no effect on [3H]L-glutamate uptake.

comments.species:
Fig.5 "Hippocampal neurons were cultured from P0 Long-Evans **rats** (Charles River) "
Fig.5+6 (Suppl.Info.): "HEK293T cells were transfected with myc-tagged mouse LRRTM4" The overexpression construct is of **mouse** species.
Fig.8: "Embryonic day 15.5 mouse embryos were electroporated with control or shLRRTM4 plasmids, "

24/5/2017 Pim
Because of the species of the OE construct and the experiments in mice the annotated species should be mouse.
comments.rationale:
- Overexpression of LRRTM4-Fc decreases excitatory synapse density in DIV14 hippocampal neurons (Figure 5, Myc-tagged LRRTM4).
- Synaptogenic activity of LRRTM4 in HEK cells (Figures 6A–6D). (HEK cells, Myc-tagged LRRTM4).
- LRRTM4 knockdown significantly decreases the density of dendritic protrusions in vivo and reduced synaptic currents (ctx neurons, shRNA KD).

24/5/2017 Pim
- All points to a role of LRRTM4 in synapse assembly (aka synapse formation) via a trans-synaptic interaction with GPC4.

comments.species:
To determine biochemically whether the rat unc-47 homologue
encodes the vesicular GABA transporter, we expressed the cDNA in
rat pheochromocytoma PC12 cells.
comments.rationale:
The paper characterizes for the first time the vesicular GABA transporter.

In figure 5a light vesicles purified by differential centrifugation from PC12 cell clones stably expressing VGAT are tested for  3H-GABA uptake and show a more uptake than membranes prepared from untransfected PC12 cells. 
Figure 5c demonstrates specificity of the transporter to GABA by testing the block of 3H-GABA uptake using a series of compounds at increasing concentrations.

comments.species:
Supp info: Hippocampal neurons were isolated from E18 RAT embryos and cultured as previously described (Ehlers, 2000).
Homeostatic scaling and baseline mEPSC recordings (Fig 7). Whole-cell voltage clamp recordings were performed on DIV 17-21 hippocampal neurons cultured at high density on poly-D-lysine coated glass coverslips. Species not stated but presumably rat (see above).
DHPG-induced synaptic depression (Fig 8). Hippocampal neuronal cultures were prepared from postnatal day 0 pups from C57BL/6 wild type MICE as described previously (Canal et al., 2011)
comments.rationale:
* Triad3A/RNF216 is an E3 ubiquitin ligase targeting Arc—an activity-regulated gene product that regulates AMPA receptor endocytosis and synaptic plasticity.
*By limiting Arc protein levels induced by synaptic activity, Triad3A regulates Arc-dependent forms of synaptic plasticity.
* Clathrin-Localized Triad3A Controls GluA1 AMPAR Endocytosis (Fig 6)
* Triad3A Is Required for Activity- Induced Upscaling of Synaptic Strength (Fig 7)

comments.species:
From M&M and results sections:  
 -Rabbit polyclonal antibodies were generated against mouse importin  2 (mPendulin).
 -Primary cultured hippocampal neurons were prepared from P0–P1 Black 6 mouse or Sprague-Dawley rat pups.
-Synaptosome and postsynaptic density (PSD) fractions were prepared from adult rat forebrain.

13/6/2017 Pim
- There are two species that are featured in this paper (rat and mouse). I allowed annotation to mouse based on the confocal data.
comments.rationale: Authors show, using a specific antibody, that importin alpha 2 is present in rat forebrain synaptosomal and PSD fractions. In primary hippocampal cultures, immunoreactivity of importin alpha 2 colocalized with the postsynaptic density marker PSD-95. Altogether, this data supports the localization of importin alpha 1 in the postsynaptic region.

comments.species:
From M&M:
Pregnant Oncins France souche A (OFA; a substrain of Sprague Dawley) rats (Charles River) were used for primary neuron cultures, and 2-month-old OFA rats of both sexes were used for biochemical analysis of brain tissue.

14/6/2017 Pim:
 In rat no reviewed sequences exist and protein names "Chmp4bl1" and "Chmp4b" are filed under a single non-reviewed sequence.
comments.rationale: Authors found CHMP4B present in synaptoneurosomal fractions from rat cortical lysates and highly enriched in PSDI fractions. PSDI fractions are the insoluble material obtained by treating synaptoneuronamal fractions with Triton X100. Unlike PSD95, CHMP4B was solubilized after treatment of this fraction with more stringent detergents, suggesting that it is a peripherally attached PSD protein.

comments.species: From abstract, "We report here that synaptojanin 1–deficient mice exhibit neurological defects and die shortly after birth".
comments.rationale:
The authors generate synaptojanin 1 knock out (KO) mice. Previous studies had established that synaptojanin is a lipid phosphatase dephosphorylating PtdIns(4,5)P2 to PtdIns(4)P. PtdIns(4,5)P2 interacts with numerous components required for coating of clathrin coated vesicles (CCVs). The KO mice display an accumulation of CCVs in the presynaptic nerve terminal (fig 3) and recovery from synaptic depression following a strong stimulation (10Hz for 200 sec), an indication of SV recycling is strongly reduced in the KO mice.

19/6/2017 Pim
- Justifcation for selected term by expert: "When synaptojanin is null the presynaptic nerve terminal accumulates CCVs (fig 3A/C/D). This not seen in the wt animals (fig 3B) and in fact one almost never observes CCVs in nerve terminals under wt conditions. This is because the clathrin coats are rapidly removed. This observation is entirely consistent with the fact that synaptojanin dephosphorylates PtdIns(4,5)P2 and this PtdIns species is required for the clathrin coating of CCVs. The inference is that if the CCVs can not uncoat, then the SVs can not rejoin the SV functional pool."

comments.species: From materials and methods "Primary neuronal cultures were prepared from hippocampi of P1–P3 Wistar rats".
comments.rationale:
The authors use siRNA to knock down AP180 in cultured rat hippocampal neurons. Using synaptobrevin pHlourin they find a defect in internalization of synaptobrevin. However, there is no defect in internalization of vGlut pHlourin. They thus argue that AP180 is not involved in synaptic vesicle endocytosis per se but in the sorting of synaptobrevin to synaptic vesicles.

27/5/3017 Pim
Expert has selected term 'synaptic vesicle endocytosis (GO:0048488)', and state in the description field: "They thus argue that AP180 is not involved in synaptic vesicle endocytosis per se but in the sorting of synaptobrevin to synaptic vesicles.". AP180 is described in literature as an adapter protein involved in the selection of cargo for clathrin mediated endocytosis. These data show that AP180 does this for some (synaptobrevin), not all (VGlut) SV cargo's. Since synaptobrevin is a SV component I can agree to apply the term 'synaptic vesicle endocytosis (GO:0048488)' to it. In the definition of this term the aggregation of cargo adapters is part of the endocytosis process (so the "regulates...." box does not have to be checked).

So, I agree to this annotation.

comments.species: From materials and methods, "Primary neuronal cultures were prepared from hippocampi of P1–P3 Wistar rats".

The authors use siRNA to knock down CALM in cultured rat hippocampal neurons. Using synaptobrevin pHlourin they find a defect in internalization of synaptobrevin. However, there is no defect in internalization of vGlut pHlourin. They thus argue that CALM is not involved in synaptic vesicle endocytosis per se but in the sorting of synaptobrevin to synaptic vesicles.

29/5/2017 Pim
- From Uniprot: "Assembly protein recruiting clathrin and adapter protein complex 2 (AP2) to cell membranes at sites of coated-pit formation and clathrin-vesicle assembly" PICALM BP is part of the endocytosis process -> "regulates ..." box is not checked.
- Synaptobrevin is a marker protein of SV's

comments.species: From the abstract, "We have now generated amphiphysin 1 knockout mice".
comments.rationale:
The authors generate an amphiphysin I KO mouse. In fig3 they demonstrate that uptake of the endocytic tracer FM2-10 is reduced in synaptosomes prepared from KO mice when compared to wild-type mice.

In fig 5 the authors use EM to demonstrate that loading of synaptic vesicles with a fluid phase tracer, HRP is decreased in cortical neurons prepared from amphiphysin KO mice.

comments.species: from legend to Fig. 5, "Localization of p145 and synapsin I by double immunofluorescence in frozen sections of rat brain".
comments.rationale: An antibody against synaptojanin 1 (then called p145) was used for immunofluorescence in frozen sections of rat brain. Synaptojanin was localized to presynaptic nerve terminals based on co-localization with synapsin. The GO term cytosol was selected because at this level it is not possible to define better localization.

comments.species:
Three adult Wistar rats and two adult rhesus monkeys (Macaca mulatta) of both
sexes were perfused, and brain tissue was prepared as described.
comments.rationale: NCS-1 is found in dendritic shafts and spines. Pre-immbedding immunolabeling of NCS-1 in striatum brain slices from rat. The NCS-1 signal was enhanced by a DAB reaction. No KO control or antibody verifications. The images show labeling for NCS-1 in spines and dendritic shafts. No quantifications. DAB signal may diffuse to a rather large distance from the primary antibody, making the spatial resolution of such information difficult to interpret, hence the annotation to 'postsynaptic cytosol' .

comments.species: Brainstem slices were prepared from Wister rats (14 - 18 days old) as described (1, 2).
comments.rationale:
Study in the calyx of Held synapse to determine the effects of NCS-1 infusion into the presynaptic compartment.

Figure 1a demonstrates that the infusion of NCS-1 leads to a transient (circa 5 minute) facilitation of the presynaptic Ca2+ current (measured very precisely in this synapse). 

Figure 1b demonstrates a negative shift in the current-voltage (I-V) curve of Ca2+ channels, suggesting a direct effect of the NCS-1 overexpression on Ca2+ channel properties. The inclusion of BAPTA together with NCS-1 abolished the effect on the I-V curve, suggesting that the effect of NCS-1 on the Ca2+ channels is Ca2+-dependent. Specifically, the 10 to 90% rise time of the Ca2+ current is faster is calyces where NCS-1 is infused, indicating a direct effect on channel properties.

Figure 2 demonstrates that the Ca2+ current facilitation caused by the perfusion of NCS-1 occludes the Ca2+ current facilitation that is usually observed during paired-pulse stimulation.

6/6/2017 Pim
A C-terminal peptide of NCS-1 that lacks the Ca-binding domain does not show the effect mentioned above, but blocks the effect of infused full length NCS-1 (Fig.4). This suggests that the Ca-effects are not mediated by a Ca-binding/buffering function of the protein, and are likely the result of direct interaction with the target protein (VGCC?). The SyNGO term 'calcium ion binding involved in regulation of presynaptic cytosolic calcium levels (GO:0099534)' is not relevant therefore for the NCS-1 protein.

comments.species:
Mutant Mouse Lines:
HYH mice were provided by Dr. C.A. Walsh...
βSNAP-KO mice were generated...

6/6/2017 Pim

comments.rationale:
Alpha-SNAP supports SV priming by determining the availability of free SNARE components, particularly during phases of high synaptic activity.

Alpha-SNAP KO mice are embryonically lethal (probably due to its function in other cellular membrane trafficking processes) and couldn't be used in the study. Therefore a hypomorph mutant (HYH) was used that results in a 50% reduction in alpha-SNAP protein levels. Synaptic transmission in autaptic hippocampal neuron cultures was unaffected in this mutant (Fig.S5A-E). Beta-SNAP KO mice were generated in this study. Synaptic transmission in autaptic hippocampal neuron cultures was unaffected in beta-SNAP KO mice (Fig.S6).

Therefore, in the study a Beta-SNAP KO / HYH-double mutant was used since the single mutants did not exhibit any phenotypes, indicating that alpha- and betaSNAP have largely redundant functions. Double mutant mice exhibited a 70% reduction in combined alpha/beta-SNAP protein levels in brain homogenates (Fig.4A), an increase in assembled SNARE complexes (Fig.4B) due to a defect in SNARE-complex disassembly, and a small (~25%) reduction in the basal RRP size measured by hypertonic sucrose and high-frequency stimulation, with no changes in the EPSC size (Fig. 4C-F;Fig. 5A-C). 40 Hz and 100 Hz stimulation and calcimycin treatment revealed a strong perturbation in RRP refilling in double mutant neurons during/after high activity and elevated calcium (Fig. 5D-F, 6E-H).

Overexpression of alpha-SNAP in double mutant neurons rescued the phenotype (Fig.7).
Exogenous glutamate application was not changed in the double mutant before or after 100 Hz stimulation, indicating a selective presynaptic effect (Fig.8).
SNARE-binding assays demonstrate that alpha- and beta-SNAP do not differ in their ability to be incorporated in the 20S complex composed of the SNARE-complex, SNAPs and NSF (Fig.S2E), indicating that they do not have different interaction partners in the synapse and probably have largely redundant functions.

comments.species: Subcellular fractions of rat brain homogenate were prepared according to procedures originally described by...
comments.rationale:
SNAP= soluble N-ethylmaleimide fusion protein attachment protein.
Subcellular fractionation and Western Blot with an isoform-specific antibody against alpha-SNAP indicates that alpha-SNAP is present in membrane and soluble fractions of synaptosomes (Fig.3). 

Immunohistochemical analysis indicates the presence of alphaSNAP in cell bodies of neuron and glia and in synapse-rich areas in some brain regions (e.g. hippocampal mossy fiber terminals (Fig. 4). Pre-embedding electron microscopy of tissue sections and crude synaptic membranes indicates the presence of diffuse alpha-SNAP immunoreactivity in both pre- and postsynaptic regions (Fig.6), often close to synaptic vesicles (e.g. Fig.5A, in the NMJ).

Isoform-specific anti-SNAP antibodies were raised to the sequences:(C)LRIKKTIQGDEEDLR (anti-α-SNAP, residues 281–295 of α-SNAP). Immunoblotting analysis demonstrates the specificity of the antibody (Fig.1)

comments.species:
Primary cell cultures: Rat hippocampal neurons were cultured as previously described41 with slight modifications

7/6/2017 Pim
- Species of the NCS-1 overexpression construct is not mentioned in the paper. Species information requested at Prof. Schweizer (felixs@ucla.edu, d.d. 7/6/2017).
comments.rationale:
The paper studies the effect of NCS-1 overexpression in continental rat hippocampal neuron culture. Double patch clamp experiments in paired neurons allow the comparison between presynaptic-transfected and presynaptic-non-transfected neurons. The paper essentially shows that presynaptic overexpression of NCS-1 leads to a switch to activity-dependent facilitation, from the otherwise observed depression in such cultures.

Figure 1 demonstrates that in paired recordings from reciprocally connected neurons depression is seen in non-transfected presynaptic neurons whereas facilitation is seen at NCS-1 presynapticly transfected synapses.
Figure 2 shows that even though the initial EPSC amplitudes are similar between controls and NCS-1-expressing neurons (Figure 2d), facilitation in seen in NCS-1-transfected synapses and depression in controls. This suggests that the effect of overexpression is on activity-dependent, rather than on basal transmitter release.
Figure 4 shows that in NCS-1-transfected synapses continues facilitation is seen during high frequency stimulus trains.

comments.species: From results, "To identify proteins that affect synaptic transmission and plasticity, we performed genetic screens using eyFLP technology ( Newsome et al., 2000; Stowers and Schwarz, 1999 ;  Verstreken et al., 2003). These screens allow us to identify flies that carry random chemically induced (EMS) mutations that affect synaptic transmission in photoreceptors, circumventing the organismal lethality associated with these mutations. Flies with mutant eyes were screened by recording electroretinograms (ERGs)...".
comments.rationale: The authors use a screen to identify proteins in Drosophila melanogaster that carry random chemically induced (EMS) mutations that affect synaptic transmission in photoreceptors. This led to the identification of tweek. To demonstrate that tweek is involved in endocytosis, the authors used neuromuscular junctions from third instar larvae. In figure 3C/D they demonstrate that tweek mutants have decreased uptake of the dye FM1-43 into the presynaptic terminal in response to a 10Hz stimulation. Uptake of FM1-43 is well established as a measure of synaptic vesicle endocytosis. In figure 3E/F they use siRNA  to knock down tweek, which also leads to decreased FM1-43 uptake.

comments.species: Briefly, forebrains of one or two mice were homogenized...
comments.rationale:
FXYD6 is localized to presynaptic and postsynaptic membranes. 

FXYD6 is a poorly characterized member of the FXYD protein family with one transmembrane domain (See reference). In the present study it has been found to be specifically enriched in FASS-sorted, VGluT1Venus-containing synaptosomes. Subcellular fractionation revealed FXYD6 to be strongly enriched in the synaptic plasma membrane fraction (LP1B, Fig.6 B). Immunocytochemistry of cultured hippocampal neurons revealed a somatodendritic and axonal localization and punctate labelling in direct apposition to VGluT1 and PSD-95 immunoreactivity (Fig.6D). Pre-embedding immuno-gold labelling demonstrates localization of FXYD6 at presynaptic, axonal, and dendritic plasma membranes in the hippocampus and striatum (Fig.6E,F and Fig. S3D).

Antibody: FXYD6 (1:2,000; Delprat et al, 2007): A polyclonal FXYD6 antibody directed against a C-terminal glu- tathione S-transferase fusion peptide of mouse FXYD6 (62- CSFNQKPRAPGDEEAQVENLITTNAAEPQKAEN) was pro- duced by Pascal Béguin. No KO-control.

comments.species: From introduction, "Exons 2–6 of the PIPK1γ gene (Pip5k1c; hereafter referred to as PIPK1γ), which encode most of the catalytic region, were deleted by homologous recombination in mouse...".
comments.rationale:
In fig 4b the authors use cortical cultures from control and knockout mice. Using transfected syaptopHlourin they demonstrated that endocytosis, as determined by quenching of pHlourin fluorescence is decreased in KO mice compared to control following a 10 Hz for 30 sec stimulus. In fig 4d they use the same experimental set up to demonstrate that endocytosis is decreased in the KO mice during stimulation.

In fig 3C,D the authors demonstrate that synapses in the KO mice depress faster in response to a 20 Hz train of 1000 action potentials. fig 3E reveals that the readily-releasable pool of synaptic vesicles is smaller in the KO mice. 

In fig 5C, the increase in CCVs observed following stimulation of cortical neurons with KCl (driving synaptic vesicle release) is less in KO neurons than in control neurons.

comments.species: From results, "Immunofluorescence of rat brain sections taken from the brain stem and stained with anti-PIPKIγ antibodies...".
comments.rationale: Fig 2 uses immunofluorescence analysis to demonstrate that PIP kinase Igamma is localized in the presynaptic compartment. Fig 6 uses immunogold electron microscopy to demonstrate that PIP kinase Igamma is localized to the presynaptic plasma membrane as well as the cytososl and coated endocytic intermediates. In figure 6C, the authors report a strikingly selective localization of PIPKIγ immunoreactivity on membrane regions directly adjacent to clathrin-coated buds while synaptic vesicles were consistently unlabelled.

comments.species: From the abstract, "Syndapin I knockout (KO) mice...".
comments.rationale:
The authors generate a syndapin 1 KO mouse. In figure 3 they use FM1-43 uptake assays to measure endocytosis in cultured hippocampal neurons. At low frequency stimulation there was a very small decrease in FM1-43 dye uptake but at higher frequency stimulation there was larger relative decrease in SV endocytosis when comparing KO to wt. In figure 4 they use EM in the mouse retina. This synapse fires extensively in the dark. Shifting to light causes a strong compensatory endocytosis. The synapses from KO mice showed numerous irregularities when shifting to light including accumulation of clathrin-coated pits at the plasma membrane and alterations in SV size.

In figure 7, the authors use whole‐cell recordings from CA1 pyramidal neurons of syndapin I KO mice and observe reduced frequencies of miniature excitatory and inhibitory potentials consistent with a defect in synaptic vesicle recycling in syndapin I KO neurons. 

19/6/2017 Pim
- Literal: "Detailed molecular analyses demonstrate that syndapin I plays an important role in the recruitment of all dynamin isoforms, central players in vesicle fission reactions, to the membrane." Since syndapin seems involved in the recruitment of dynamin I do no classify this protein as a "regulator of..." SVE.

Literal:
"Notably, L3L was enriched in detergent-resistant PSD fractions (Figure S2E). These data indicate
that LRRTM3 (at least L3L) is associated with excitatory synaptic membranes. In accord with biochemical data, confocal microscopy revealed that L3L immunoreactivity was closely associated with the excitatory marker proteins VGLUT1 and PSD-95, but not with the inhibitory marker proteins GAD67 and gephyrin in cultured hippocampal neurons (Figures S2F–S2J). L3L immunoreactivity was also prominent outside VGLUT1- or PSD-95-positive excitatory synaptic sites, consistent with its widespread distribution in various subcellular fractions (see Figure S2D). To corroborate these observations, we expressed monomeric Venus (mVenus) fluorescent protein fused to L3L (L3L-mVenus) in cultured hippocampal neurons and immunostained them for VGLUT1 and PSD-95 (Figure S2K). mVenus immunofluorescence in L3L-mVenus-expressing neurons was clustered at excitatory synapse sites (55% ± 5% and 49% ± 6% of L3L-mVenus-positive puncta matches with PSD-95 and VGLUT1, respectively), suggesting that endogenous L3L proteins, similar to L3S, localize to excitatory synapses"

Fig. 5a shows that trsnsfected YFP-LRRTM1 colocalize with VGLUT1 and PSD-95

Literal:
"To begin to assess subcellular localization, we created extracellular YFP fusions of LRRTM1 and LRRTM2 and transfected hippocampal neurons in culture. YFP-LRRTM-1 or -2 expressed at low level in hippocampal neurons traffic to dendrites and assume a punctate, synaptic-like pattern (Figures 5A–5C). YFP-LRRTM-1 or -2 colocalized with PSD-95 family proteins opposite VGLUT1
puncta. YFP-LRRTM-1 and -2 appeared to be exclusively colocalized with the excitatory postsynaptic scaffolding proteins of the PSD-95 family but not with the inhibitory postsynaptic scaffolding protein gephyrin."

8/6/2017 Pim
- Localization of LRRTM1 to the postsynaptic membrane is derived from (i) colocalization with PSD-95 and (ii) the TM domains of the proteins, (iii) the compartment of related protein LRRTM2 (Fig.7), and, most importantly, the (iii) synaptogenic ability of the protein when expressed on the plasma membrane of non-neuronal cells. It must be noted that in this publication and in others (PMID:17667961) the protein is very inefficiently transported to the plasma membrane. Literal: "Although the most synaptogenic factors tended to have increased axon contact area, the same phenomenon did not hold true for LRRTM1-CFP. This result is likely due to the reduced surface expression of LRRTM1 relative to the other family members. We observed that LRRTM1 accumulates extensively in the endoplasmic reticulum of transfected nonneuronal cells (data not shown), and this result has been observed previously (Francks et al., 2007)."
- I agree with the experts to not choose a more specific term "postsynaptic density memrane" because of the sub-resolution data.

comments.rationale:
The paper examines the sub cellular localization of GlyT2 in rat brainstem and spinal cord tissue using immunogold labelling for electron microscopy, sub cellular fractionation and immunoisolation of synaptic membranes. 

The authors have generated a new antibody for GlyT2:'The novel antibody
recognized a single band of the expected size in brain tissue (90 kDa) and the staining was largely displaced by the Nt-GLYT2-Glutathion-S-transferase (Nt-
GLYT2-GST) fusion protein that was used as antigen'.

Figure 1-Electron microscopy of double peroxidase and gold-particle immunolabeling performed on ventral horn of spinal cord tissue (1a) or brainstem tissue (ab). Immunogold labeling of Glyt2 is seen in the synaptic plasma membrane and in the presynaptic compartment.

Figure 2 - sub cellular fractionation of brainstem tissue. Strong GlyT2 labeling is seen in the synaptosomal P2 fraction, in the plasma membrane LP1 fraction, and in the synaptic vesicle membrane LP2 fractions. The LP2 fraction was further isolated on a Glycerol gradient to separate vesicles of different sizes. Strong signal for GlyT2 was seen in the fractions 11 and 12, which include plasma membrane proteins and is not enriched for synaptic vesicle proteins.

Figure 5b shows a robust immunostaining signal for GlyT2 on the plasma membrane of brainstem neurons in culture.

- Based on the known transmembrane topology of the protein, the "integral component of ... membrane" term was chosen.

comments.species: The engineered rat NTTll clone is about 3.5 kb, which exhibits glycine uptake activity in Xenopus oocytes.
comments.rationale:
The paper describes the cloning and characterization of the Glycine transporter 2.

Figure 7 shows the Kinetics of H3-labeled glycine uptake into Xenopus oocytes injected with synthetic mRNA of GLYT2. 
Table 1 describes an experiment aimed at examining the transporters' specificity, by evaluating the uptake of H3-labeled glycine in the presence of other unlabeled compounds. Only unlabelled Glycine can suppress the uptake of H3-labeled glycine.
Taken together, this data shows that the cloned transporter functions as a specific glycine transporter.

comments.rationale:
SV31 actively transports zinc (zn2+) in a proton-dependent manner.

SV31 is able to bind zinc: Recombinant SV31 expression in NGF-differentiated PC12 cells and measurement of zinc binding activity using a cell-permeable zinc indicator FluoZin-3. Comparison of wild-type SV31 and mutated SV31 (putative zinc-binding sites were mutated) revealed significantly reduced zinc-binding capacities for the mutant (Fig.6c).

SV31 is able to transport zinc in a proton-dependent manner (Fig.7): SV31 proteoliposomes acidified to pH 6.0 containing the indicator FluoZin-1 exhibit an accumulation of luminal fluorescence after addition of 100 µM Zn2+. SV31 proteoliposomes at pH 8.0, and proteoliposomes containing mutated SV31 acidified to pH 6.0 do not exhibit an accumulation of fluorescence after zinc application.

comments.rationale:
Complexin-3 is expressed in different brain regions in rat (Fig.2B, 3) and mice (3D). 

Subcellular fractionation demonstrates the presence of Complexin-3 in the cytosolic synaptic fraction (LS2, comparable to Complexin-1/2), but is is also enriched in the light membrane pellet (P3), but also detectable in the crude synaptic vesicular fraction (LP2), and in synaptic membranes (LP1 and SPM; Fig. 3 E). 

In the retina, Complexin-3 co-localizes with the presynaptic SV marker VgluT1 in the inner plexiform layer (rod bipolar cells, IHC, Fig.4). Complexin-3 is farnesylated at the CAAX-box motifs at their COOH terminus (HEK cell assay, Fig.5). In comparison to Complexin-1/2, overexpressed, farnesylated Complexin-3 is localized to synapses in mouse hippocampal cultures (colocalized with the SV marker synaptophysin by ICC). Overexpression of a mutated Complexin-3 variant that cannot be farnesylated, is diffusely distributed throughout the neuron like Complexin-1/2 (Fig. 7).

Polyclonal antisera directed against CPXs III and IV were generated with His-tagged fusion proteins as antigens (Eurogentech). There is cross-reactivity of the antibody between Complexin-3 and -4 (Fig.3B), but only Complexin-3 is expressed in the brain.

comments.species: Retinas from dark-adapted Cplx3−/−, littermate Cplx3+/+, or C57B6 mice (1–6 months old) (Reim et al., 2009) were isolated...
comments.rationale:
Conclusion: "Our study supports the growing consensus that Cplxs (Cplx3 in RBs and Cplx1 and Cplx2 at conventional synapses) act to stabilize fully primed vesicles in a release-ready state and to suppress unregulated Ca2+-dependent spontaneous and asynchronous release of immature vesicles at early stages of the priming process."

Electrophysiological recordings in mouse retina tissue analyzing wildtype- and Complexin-3 KO mice. Mouse retinal bipolar cells only express Complexin-3 and are therefore a good synapse to study the function of this protein (it is known that Complexins are partially redundant and can compensate for the loss of one isoform). 

The study demonstrates a loss of phasic release (reduced EPSC amplitude; Fig.1), increase in spontaneous release (mEPSC frequency Fig.2+6) and asynchronous release (Fig. 7). Impaired phasic release was manifested both in a reduced functional RRP and in an increased EPSC latency. The diminished functional RRP likely resulted from the absence of a facilitatory effect of Cplx3 on Ca2+-dependentexocytosis (Fig. 4) rather than from physical vesicle depletion as assessed by electron microscopy (Fig. S1).

comments.species: 2.2. Isolation of synaptic vesicles: Synaptic vesicles were isolated from 3 months old Wistar rat brain essentially as described (Huttner et al., 1983).

Figure 2a: In the synaptic vesicle fraction obtained during the subcellular fractionation of rat brain tissue GlyT1, VGLUT1 and synaptophysin expression can be detected by western blotting.
Figure 2b: in fractions isolated from sucrose gradient sedimentation of the LP2 fraction prepared for figure 2a, GlyT1, VGLUT1 and synaptophysin expression can be detected in overlapping fractions by western blotting.

Figure 4: immunogold-EM of Sucrose gradient purified LP2 fractions number 5–8 demonstrating that GlyT1 can be found at the membrane of vesicles in this fraction (4a). Colocalization of GlyT1 with synaptophysin (4b) or with VGLUT1 (4c) at the same membrane compartment demonstrated by dual immunogold-EM.

No knockout controls, antibody source is not mentioned.

comments.rationale:
Authors used a polyclonal antibody against AIDA-1 generated in rabbit to study the protein distribution in vivo. This antibody identifies at least different  isoforms of AIDA-1 (AIDA-1d, AIDA-1e and EB-1), being AIDA-1d and 1e found in synaptosomes and PSD fractions.  Immunogold EM performed in hippocampus and more precisely in CA1 stratum radiatum shows gold particles closely associated with the PSD. Analysis of the location of those particles reveals a mean distance of 13 +/- 2 nm from the postsynaptic plasma membrane.

- Literal: "AIDA-1 is distributed fairly uniformly along the PSD, decreasing rapidly at its edge"

comments.species: Experiments were carried out on 13 adult male Sprague-Dawley rats ranging from 3 to 10 months old, from Charles River Laboratories (Raleigh, NC). Four were used for diaminobenzidine (DAB) staining, four were used for confocal microscopy, two were used for preembed- ding electron microscopy, and three were used for post- embedding electron microscopy.
comments.rationale: Authors used a polyclonal antibody against AIDA-1 generated in rabbit to study the protein distribution in vivo. This antibody identifies at least different  isoforms of AIDA-1 (AIDA-1d, AIDA-1e and EB-1), being AIDA-1d and 1e found in synaptosomes and PSD fractions. Confocal imaging revealed a prominent staining of AIDA1 in the stratum lucidum of CA3 which colocalized with VGLUT1 staining, suggesting the localization of AIDA1 in mossy fiber terminals. This was confirmed by subsequent preembedding immunoperoxidase experiments that showed immunolabeling of AIDA1 in mossy fiber terminals, concentrated at the center of synaptic vesicle pools.

comments.rationale:
Authors used an antibody that specifically recognizes CRTC1 but not CRTC2 to study the localization of CRTC1 using spinning disk confocal microscopy. CRTC1 immunoreactivity was found in dendrites and spines, with  99% of PSD95-positive puncta containing CRTC1. This colocalization is activity regulated. Accordingly, CRTC1 was found in synaptoneurosome and PSD fractions.  
Pull-down experiments using recombinant proteins show that CRTC1 binds to 14-3-3 epsilon, a protein found in dendritic spines, suggesting that the synaptic tethering of CRTC1 relies on the interaction with 14-3-3 epsilon. This interaction is also regulated by activity.

Clustering of the active zone marker bassoon could also be detected at LRR-AP bead-axon contact sites. In fact, there appeared to be separation between the bassoon-labeled active zone and the VGLUT1-positive vesicle pool, with the active zone most closely apposed to the bead surface (Figure 4B, right panel, inset..."

comments.rationale:
The paper characterizes the first GABA transporter, named GAT1.
Figure 1 demonstrates the 3H-GABA uptake assay in Xenopus oocytes injected with the GAT1 mRNA.
1A - a histogram comparing the uptake of oocytes expressing the transporter in comparison to controls.

1D - Effect of GABA uptake blockers on the GABA transport.

Taking together, the data points to a role of the GAT1 protein in GABA transport.

This suggests that GAT3 is the transporter of GABA, beta-alanine, and taurine.

comments.species:
The function of LRRTM3 in excitatory synapse formation was done in LRRTM3 KO mice. Hovever synapse-promoting activities of LRRTM3 was done in rat hippocampal neurons. 

Literal from Supplemetary M&M
"Cultured hippocampal neurons were prepared from E18 rat brains, as described previously"
"Lrrtm3 Knockout Mice. Lrrtm3-KO mice have been generated previously"

8/6/2017 Pim
- species of the over-expressed LRRTM3 is **human**. Literal Suppl,M&M: "pGW1-LRRTM3[Long]-mVenus
encodes full-length human LRRTM3 fused to mVenus ... Full-length LRRTM3
(LRRTM3[Long] and LRRTM3[Short]) and LRRTM4 (LRRTM4[Long] and LRRTM4[Short]),
excluding the corresponding signal peptide sequences, were PCR-amplified,..."
- shRNA KD experiments essay LRRTM3 function in rat neurons --> rat species of the protein.
- Data in Fig.1 on presynapse assebly I chose *human* species based on the over-expression construct used in this figure.
comments.rationale:
Fig. 1f,g,h,i LRRTM3 has a excitatory synapse-promoting activity
Literal
"However, we found that the newly engineered L3S and L3L constructs displayed a strong ability comparable to that of LRRTM2 (L2) and LRRTM4 (L4S and L4L) to trigger presynaptic differentiation in cultured hippocampal neurons, suggesting that LRRTM3 also possesses potent synaptogenic activity (Figures 1F and 1G). Next, we examined whether LRRTM3 exhibits synapse-promoting activities by transfecting hippocampal neurons at 10 days in vitro (DIV10) with mVenus-fused L3L or L3S and immunostaining them at DIV14 for excitatory synaptic markers (VGLUT1 and Shank) and for inhibitory synaptic markers (GAD67 and gephyrin) (Figures 1H, 1I,"

Fig. 2, the knockdown of LRRTM3 with shRNA reduces excitatory, but not inhibitory, synapse numbers in DG granule neurons
Literal:
"To accomplish this, we transfected cultured DG neurons at DIV8 with vectors that express only EGFP (control) or coexpress EGFP with shRNAs against Lrrtm3 (L3 KD) or Lrrtm4 (L4 KD). We then immunostained the transfected neurons for VGLUT1 or GAD67 at DIV14 and quantified the density of excitatory and inhibitory synapses on dendrites of the transfected neurons (Figures 2A–2D). We found that the synapse loss induced by L3 or L4 KD was specific for excitatory synapses and not for inhibitory synapses (Figures 2A–2D). Strikingly, double KD of LRRTM3 and LRRTM4 (L3/L4 DKD) did not further decrease the excitatory synapse numbers than KD of either protein alone, suggesting that both LRRTM3 and LRRTM4 may share common pathways in maintenance of excitatory synapse structure at DG neurons (Figures 2A–2D)."

Fig. 4e,f, in lrrtm3-KO mice the development of excitatory, but not inhibitory synapses is mpaired in the DG
Literal
"A quantitative immunofluorescence analysis revealed a significant decrease in the intensity of VGLUT1 puncta in DG molecular layers (MML), but not in the CA1 stratum oriens (oriens), a phenotype similar to that observed in Lrrtm4-KO mice (Figures 4E and 4F; Siddiqui et al., 2013). In contrast, the intensity of GAD67 puncta was unchanged in both DG MML and CA1 oriens (Figures 4E and 4F). We next analyzed dendritic spine density in Golgi-stained brain sections."

Fig. 5, lrrtm3-KO mice have reduced excitatory synapse density in the DG, but not the CA1 Region of the Hippocampus
Literal:
"Moreover, electron microscopy analyses showed that the number of dendritic spines (i.e., asymmetric/excitatory synapses) in the DG middle molecular layer (MLL) was modestly, but significantly, decreased at P14 and P42 in Lrrtm3-KO mice (Figures 5A–5C, S5A, and S5B). This reduction in excitatory synapse density at the ultrastructural level was not observed in the CA1 pyramidal neurons of Lrrtm3-KO mice (Figures 5A–5C). In contrast, the number of GABA-positive presynaptic
boutons (i.e., symmetric/inhibitory synapse) in the DG was not reduced in Lrrtm3-KO mice (Figures 5D–5F). The thickness and length of excitatory PSD- or GABA-positive boutons were unchanged by ablation of LRRTM3 protein (Figures 5D–5F). Collectively, these results demonstrate that the loss of LRRTM3 protein decreases the number of excitatory synapses in vivo without altering their gross ultrastructure."

Fig. 6, the lrrtm3-KO Mice shows  Impaired excitatory synaptic transmission in DG granule neurons
Literal
"To determine whether excitatory synaptic function is changed as a result of genetic perturbation of LRRTM3, we performed whole-cell recordings from DG granule cells in hippocampal slices from WT and Lrrtm3-KO mice (Figure 6). We found that the amplitude of miniature excitatory postsynaptic currents (mEPSCs) was markedly reduced in LRRTM3-deficient neurons (Figures 6A–6C). The amplitude of spontaneous excitatory events (sEPSCs) was reduced to the same extent in Lrrtm3-KO neurons (Figures 6D and 6E). Strikingly, the frequency of mEPSCs was significantly increased in neurons from Lrrtm3-KO mice compared with those from WT mice, whereas the frequency of sEPSCs was not altered (Figures 6A–6E). No changes were observed in the frequency or amplitude of miniature inhibitory postsynaptic currents (mIPSCs) (Figures 6D and 6F)."

comments.species:
from M&M:
"Hippocampal neuron cultures were prepared from embryonic day 18–19 rat embryos as described previously (Brewer et al., 1993)."

And, "For all constructs except W22A and W22A tandem, murine wild-type cortactin was used as template (gift of J. Thomas Parson, University of Virginia, Charlottesville, VA)."

12/6/2017
Although species of overexpressed protein is not stated ('murine') I allow annotation to rat based on the RNAi experiments in rat neurons.
comments.rationale:
This paper describes how "knockdown of cortactin by short-interfering RNA (siRNA) results in a decrease of dendritic spines in hippocampal neurons, whereas overexpression of cortactin causes elongation of spines. In response to synaptic stimulation and NMDA receptor activation, cortactin redistributes rapidly from spines to dendritic shaft, correlating with remodeling of the actin cytoskeleton, implicating cortactin in the activity-dependent regulation of spine morphogenesis."

Thus, cortactin seems implicated in spine morphology maintenance and activity-induced reorganization. Therefore, I chose the GO term "regulation of synapse organization" to combine these two functions.

comments.species: 'A quantitative analysis of cellular and synaptic localization of GAT-1 and GAT-3 in rat neocortex'. 'Animals and tissue preparation Adult male albino rats (200–225 g; n = 7; Sprague–Dawley, Charles River, Milan, Italy) were used.'
comments.rationale:
The paper quantitatively describes the distribution of GAT-1 and GAT-3 at the rat cortex using pre-embedding peroxidase labeling and postimbedding immunogold labeling. 
Figure 2: electron microscopy images of peroxidase-based immunoreactivity in preembedded material of cortical layers 2-3.  In figure 2e dendritic labeling is evident. Figure 2I quantifies the fraction of profiles where immunoreactivity was observed in axons or dendrites.
Figure 4a-g expands this analysis . In 4D,E example images of immunoreactivity in axon terminals, perisynaptic astrocytic processes and post-synaptic elements are shown. In figure 4g a quantification of fraction of profiles where immunoreactivity was observed in the above-mentioned cellular compartments, with a further division into symmetric and asymmetric synapses.

Taken together, the data supports a postsynaptic localization of GAT-1.

comments.rationale:
Authors study the localization of Abi-1 in rat hippocampal cultures and rat brain using a monoclonal antibody against Abi-1. Immunoelectron microscopy revealed Abi-1 at postsynaptic densities. In line with this, immunostaining of Abi-1 showed colocalization of the protein with Shank3, a postsynaptic excitatory marker, while coimmunostaining with the presynaptic marker bassoon revealed a juxtaposed pattern, in agreement with the postsynaptic localization of Abi-1. Subcellular fractionation revealed enrichment of Abi-1 in PSD fractions.

14/3/2017 Pim
- Abi1 shown to interact directly with Shank3 but not with Shank1 (Fig.1). Shank3 is a typical PSD protein.

comments.rationale:
The paper uses pre-embedding immuno-EM.

Figure 1 demonstrates the specificity of a newly made antibody against human EAAT4 in this paper (anti-D537).

In figure 6, pre-embedding electron microscopic immunocytochemistry using peroxidase-based labelling shows specific staining in spines, but no staining in axons or in glial processes.

Figure 7: postembedding immunogold EM of EAAT4 demonstrating labelling in membranes of Purkinje cell spines, spine necks, and dendrites.

Figure 8 illustrates that in the vast majority of cases the immunolabelling is seen in contact sites with astroglia and not in contact sites with the postsynaptic membrane, or in the parts of the spine membrane that are in contact with
presynaptic nerve terminals.

Figure 11b - quantification of EAAT4 immunoreactivity along different parts of the Purkinje cell membrane, demonstrating that the majority of particles are found in contact sites to astroglia in dendrite (11b column b) or in spines (11b column f)

comments.species: Briefly, E18 embryos from time-mated Wistar rats were removed from the uterus...
comments.rationale:
The creatine transporter is a plasma membrane protein localized to the soma and neuronal processes of cultured rat hippocampal neurons (Fig. 3,4). 

Colabelling with MAP2 reveals a dendritic localization (Fig.3) and CRT co-localizes with the NR1 subunit of NMDA receptors (Fig.4) indicating a postsynaptic localization.

CRT antibody was produced in rabbits and affinity-purified as described previously (Mak et al. 2009 - reference 2): "Briefly, antibodies were prepared by immunising rabbits with a C-terminal fragment of the bovine CRT, expressed as a fusion protein with glutathione-S-transferase (GST) from the parasitic helminth, Schistosoma japonicum. GST-reactive antibodies were removed on a column containing immobilised GST. Antibodies, specific for the C-terminal 21 amino acids of the CRT were affinity-purified on a column containing immobilised GST fusion protein (GST-CC2) and stored (0.5 mg/mL) in phosphate buffer (−80 °C). The affinity-purified CRT antibodies recognise a ∼70 kDa glycoprotein in membranes from human embryonic kidney (HEK) 293 cells, transiently or stably expressing the CRT and also showed strong staining of the plasma membrane of these cells by immunofluorescence microscopy." No KO control.

comments.species: "... hippocampal neuron were derived from the embryos of NMRI mice at 15.5 days post conception..." p.150
comments.rationale:
Aggrecan was found in primary hippocampal neuronal cultures between pre- and postsynaptic marker proteins for both excitatory and inhibitory synapses in single plane confocal micrographs.

21/6/2017 Pim
- The images show ECM (aggrecan is used as marker protein) around synaptic elements. The authors hypothsize on a funcitonal relation; "The analysis of synapse formation with reference to perineuronal nets expression can provide important hints about how extracellular matrix helps to consolidate single cells in neuronal networks. In this work we have demonstrated that PNN-positive neurons host less VGlut1 terminals than PNN-negative ones, and thus form less completed excitatory synapses (Fig. 3A). This finding can be explained by the known capacity of PNNs to restrict synapse formation in mature neurons (Wang and Fawcett, 2012)." I agree to annotation to perisynaptic ECM based on this data.

comments.species: "Briefly adult mouse brains (2–16 months, 20 animals, 10 g wet weight) were homogenized ..." p. 915
comments.rationale: The supplemental table S1 contains 1264 proteins identified in the PSD preparation (Synaptic junctional protein preparation). As tenascins are generally described in the literature as extracellular matrix components we consider the protein as part of the perisynaptic or synaptic extracellular matrix.

comments.species: Species is stated in the title
comments.rationale: This paper confirms the localization of Tenascin R in the extracellular space surrounding the mossy fiber boutons in the hippocampal CA3 regions (Fig. 8) Various proteomic studies confirm the occurrence in the PSD protein fraction.

comments.species:
For electron microscopy, four adult (250–350 gm) male Sprague Daw- ley rats (Hilltop Lab) were anesthetized...
Subcellular fractionation: Rat brain synaptic vesicles were purified from isolated nerve terminals...
comments.rationale:
The proline transporter (PROT) is an integral membrane protein expressed in a subset of excitatory (glutamatergic, asymmetric) synapses in different brain regions. 

Pre- and postembedding immuno-EM reveals a localization to synaptic vesicles in a subset of glutamatergic terminals (Fig. 4-6). Subcellular fractionation demonstrates that PROT is highly enriched in the purified synaptic vesicle (SV) fraction, similarly to the SV proteins Synaptobrevin-2 and Synaptophysin (Fig.7). Treatment of purified SVs with a mixture of endo- and exoproteases allows the digestion of cytoplasmic domains, indicating that the N- and C-termini of PROT are cytoplasmic (Fig.8). This topology of the PROT protein is 'inverted' with respect to the plasma membrane orientation (See discussion and Fig. 9), indicating shuttling of PROT between SVs and the plasma membrane.

Antibodies: Polyclonal rabbit antibody A2 was produced and affinity-purified by Research Genetics (Huntsville, AL) against residues 2–18 from the predicted N terminus of rat PROT (KKLQEAHLRKPVTPDLL). The affinity-purified polyclonal anti- body directed against the C terminus of rat PROT, antibody C597, has been described previously (Velaz-Faircloth et al., 1995). Both antibodies were tested for its specificity by biochemistry using stably PROT expressing HEK cells and transiently expressing HeLa cells (Fig.1). C597 antibody, preabsorbed with the C-terminal antigenic peptide, did not produce any immunoreactivity by immunohistochemistry (Fig.2D).

comments.species: '... were used to amplify complementary DNAs from human cerebellar messenger RNA.'
comments.rationale:
The paper charactrerizes EAAT4 as a L-glutamate and L-aspartate transporter that shuttles these across membranes in a sodium-dependent manner.

Table 1 summarized the results of an 3H-L-glutamate and 3H-L-aspartate uptake assays in Xenopus oocytes expressing the transporter. Injected oocytes had a 30-fold higher uptake of the compounds than uninjected controls.

comments.species: Experiments were performed on young adult (3–5 week old) Swiss mice of both sexes in accordance with French Ministry of Agriculture regulations and the European Community Council
comments.rationale:
The paper characterizes the expression of EAAT4 and EAAT5 in the vestibular type I hair cells. These cells have post-synaptic calycal endings which restrict the diffusion of glutamate following endocytosis, so that uptake of glutamate by supporting cells is not plausible. 

Figure 5: immunogold-labelling electron microscopy leads to the finding that the hair cells, as well as the calycal membrane facing the synaptic cleft, both harbor EAAT4 and EAAT5, supporting the notion that the transporters are located at both the pre- and postsynaptic membranes.
Table 1 presents the quantification of the immuogold labeling.
Figure 6 is a summarizing scheme.

comments.species: The isolation of an EAAT subtype from salamander retina whose sequence differed substantially from previously reported mammalian sequences lead us to isolate the human homolog EAAT5.
comments.rationale:
In the paper the isolation of the EAAT5, an excitatory amino acid transporter is described.

In figure 3 the uptake of 3H-L-glutamate and 3H-L-Aspertate are demonstrated in oocytes injected with the EAAT5 mRNA and voltage-clamped at −60 mV. In comparison to controls (uninjected oocytes), the uptake was typically 2- to 10-fold larger. The uptake is sodium- and voltage-dependent.
These data indicate that the transporter functions as a glutamate transporter.
Table 1 summarizes specificity and kinetic values of the transporter.

comments.species: ...mice (n = 3 per group) were processed for electron microscope pre-embedding immunogold labelling as previously described...
comments.rationale: Using electron microscopy, anti-CB1 immunogold particles were found on mitochondrial membranes on presynaptic terminals of the CA1 region (as well as in the presynaptic plasma membrane: SynGO ID 807). Mitochondrial and plasma membrane staining are lost in CB1 knock out animals (CB1-/-). Rescued expression of CB1 by injection of an adeno-associated virus expressing CB1 (AAV–CB1) on CB1-/- mice recovers mitochondrial and plasma membrane localization. When a variant of CB1 with a deletion of the first 22 N-terminal amino acids is expressed on CB1-/- background mitochondrial localization is lost, although this variant is still localized to the presynaptic plasma membrane.

comments.species: Female mice (2–4 months old) were used for anatomy and biochemistry. Mice 20–30 d old of both sexes were used for electrophysiology.
comments.rationale:
CB1 localized in mitochondria (mtCB1) regulates mitochondrial respiration: using purified mitochondria from wild-type (WT) or CB1−/− brains it is shown that treatment with CB1 receptor agonists WIN (Figure 3) or THC (Figure 4a-c) reduces respiration, cAMP levels and PKA activity in neuronal mitochondria. 

Depolarization of CA1 postsynaptic pyramidal neurons mobilizes endocannabinoids, which retrogradely activate presynaptic CB1 receptors, transiently decreasing GABAergic inhibitory neurotransmission in a process known as depolarization-induced suppression of inhibition (DSI), an endocannabinoid-dependent form of short-term plasticity of inhibitory neurotransmission in the hippocampus. DSI is fully blocked by cell-permeant CB1 antagonists (AM251) but only partially blocked by cell-impermeant CB1 antagonists (hemopressin) (Figure 6A), indicating a contribution of mtCB1 activation in DSI. In addition, suppression similar to the one obtained by DSI is found only with cell-permeant agonists of CB1 (HU210) but not with cell-impermeant versions (biotinylated-HU210). Also, HU210 occludes DSI completely, whereas biotinylated-HU210 only occludes it partially, suggesting again a contribution of mtCB1 activation for DSI (Figure 6C). mtCB1 activation also results in reduced mitochondrial respiration and, additionally, direct inhibition of complex I activity using rotenone also mimics DSI, suggesting that endocannabinoid-induced DSI depends on mitochondrial respiration, which would be controlled by mtCB1 (Figure 7).
